greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write n in decimal, omit 0's, replace the k-th digit d[k] with the k-th prime, raised to d[k]-th power and multiply.
comment: Not the same as A189398: see formula.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (a(0) = 1 inserted by _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 12 2018)
formula: If n=d[1]d[2]...d[m] in decimal (0<d[k]<10: m nonzero digits), then a(n)=p[1]^d[1]*...*p[m]^d[m], where p[k] is the k-th prime. - _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 16 2014
example: For n = 0, the list of nonzero digits is empty, and the empty product equals 1.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 06 2001
ext: Corrected and extended by _Matthew Conroy_, May 13 2001
Definition corrected by _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 16 2014
Extended to a(0) = 1 by _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 12 2018
